001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util;
002
003import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
004import java.util.Locale;
005
006import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
007import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Quaternion;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Rotation;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
016
017/**
018 * Utility math methods used for camera calibration.
019 * @author WB
020 *
021 */
022public class MathUtil {
023        
024        static {
025                Locale.setDefault(Locale.US);   // TODO: should this be here?
026        }
027        
028        @Deprecated
029        public static void print(String name, RealMatrix M) {
030                System.out.println(name);
031                for (int r = 0; r < M.getRowDimension(); r++) {
032                        RealVector row = M.getRowVector(r);
033                        System.out.println("  " + r + " " + row.toString());
034                }
035        }
036        
037        @Deprecated
038        public static void print(String name, RealVector v) {
039                System.out.println(name + v.toString());
040        }
041        
042        // -------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        public static double[] toArray(Point2D p) {
045                return new double[] {p.getX(), p.getY()};
046        }
047        
048        public static Point2D.Double toPoint2D(double[] xy) {
049                return new Point2D.Double(xy[0], xy[1]);
050        }
051        
052        public static RealVector toRealVector(Point2D p) {
053                return toRealVector(p, false);
054        }
055        
056        public static RealVector toRealVector(Point2D p, boolean makeHomogeneous) {
057                if ( makeHomogeneous) {
058                        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(new double[] {p.getX(), p.getY(), 1});
059                }
060                else {
061                        return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(toArray(p));
062                }
063        }
064        
065        public static RealVector[] getColumnVectors(RealMatrix M) {
066                final int ncols = M.getColumnDimension();
067                RealVector[] colVecs = new  RealVector[ncols];
068                for (int col = 0; col < ncols; col++) {
069                        colVecs[col] = M.getColumnVector(col);
070                }
071                return colVecs;
072        }
073        
074        public static RealVector crossProduct3x3(RealVector A, RealVector B) {
075                final double[] a = A.toArray();
076                final double[] b = B.toArray();
077                final double[] c = {
078                                a[1] * b[2] - b[1] * a[2],
079                                a[2] * b[0] - b[2] * a[0],
080                                a[0] * b[1] - b[0] * a[1]
081                };
082                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(c);
083        }
084        
085        public static double det(RealMatrix M) {
086                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
087        }
088        
089        public static RealVector getRowPackedVector(RealMatrix A) {
090                double[][] AA = A.getData();
091                double[] V = new double[AA.length * AA[0].length];
092                int k = 0;
093                for (int i = 0; i < AA.length; i++) {
094                        for (int j = 0; j < AA[0].length; j++) {
095                                V[k++] = AA[i][j];
096                        }
097                }
098                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(V);
099        }
100        
101        public static RealMatrix fromRowPackedVector(RealVector V, int rows, int columns) {
102                double[][] AA = new double[rows][columns];
103                double[] data = V.toArray();
104                int k = 0;
105                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
106                        for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) {
107                                AA[i][j] = data[k++];
108                        }
109                }
110                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(AA);
111        }
112
113

154        
155        
156        /**
157         * Finds a nontrivial solution (x) to the homogeneous linear system A . x = 0
158         * by singular-value decomposition. If A has more rows than columns, the
159         * system of equations is overdetermined. In this case the returned solution
160         * minimizes the residual ||A . x|| in the least-squares sense.
161         *
162         * @param A     the original matrix.
163         * @return the solution vector x.
164         */
165        public static RealVector solveHomogeneousSystem(RealMatrix A) {
166                // TODO: needs to be validated!!
167                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(A);
168                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
169                // RealVector x = V.getColumnVector(V.getColumnDimension() - 1);
170                // return x;
171                int minIdx = Matrix.idxMin(svd.getSingularValues());
172                return V.getColumnVector(minIdx);
173        }
174
175        
176        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] cvec) {
177                double[] hvec = new double[cvec.length + 1];
178                for (int i = 0; i < cvec.length; i++) {
179                        hvec[i] = cvec[i];
180                        hvec[hvec.length - 1] = 1;
181                }
182                return hvec;
183        }
184        
185        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] hvec) {
186                double[] cvec = new double[hvec.length - 1];
187                final double s = 1 / hvec[hvec.length - 1];     // TODO: check for zero factor
188                for (int i = 0; i < hvec.length - 1; i++) {
189                        cvec[i] = s * hvec[i];
190                }
191                return cvec;
192        }
193        
194        public static String getInfo(double[][] A) {
195                return String.format("Matrix: rows=%d, columns=%d", A.length, A[0].length);
196        }
197        
198        public static String getInfo(double[] x) {
199                return String.format("Vector: dimension=%d", x.length);
200        }
201        
202        public static double mean(double[] x) {
203                final int n = x.length;
204                if (n == 0) 
205                        return 0;
206                double sum = 0;
207                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
208                        sum = sum + x[i];
209                }
210                return sum / n;
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * 
215         * @param x a sequence of real values 
216         * @return the variance of the values in x (sigma^2)
217         */
218        public static double variance(double[] x) {
219                final int n = x.length;
220                if (n == 0) 
221                        return 0;
222                double sum = 0;
223                double sum2 = 0;
224                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
225                        sum = sum + x[i];
226                        sum2 = sum2 + x[i] * x[i];
227                }
228                return (sum2 - (sum * sum) / n) / n;
229        }
230        
231        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
232        
233        public static Quaternion toQuaternion(Rotation r) {
234                return new Quaternion(r.getQ0(), r.getQ1(), r.getQ2(), r.getQ3());
235        }
236        
237        public static Rotation toRotation(Quaternion q) {
238                return new Rotation(q.getQ0(), q.getQ1(), q.getQ2(), q.getQ3(), true);
239        }
240        
241        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
242        
243        /**
244         * Calculates the 'inverse condition number' (RCOND() in Matlab)
245         * of the given matrix (0,...,1, ideally close to 1).
246         * @param Ma the matrix
247         * @return the inverse condition number
248         */
249        public static double inverseConditionNumber(double[][] Ma) {
250                RealMatrix M = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(Ma);
251                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(M);
252                return svd.getInverseConditionNumber();
253        }
254
255        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
256        
257        /**
258         * For testing only.
259         * @param args ignored
260         */
261        public static void main (String[] args) {
262                //double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}};
263                double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}, {-3, 7, 2}};
264                {
265                        RealMatrix AM = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
266                        RealVector x = solveHomogeneousSystem(AM);
267                        System.out.println("Solution x = " + x.toString());
268                }
269                // Solution x = {0.649964237; -0.7338780288; 0.1974070146}
270        }
